div1.head: Letter from the Acting Adjutant General to Walter Reed, July 22, 1896
div1.opener:
War Department,
ADJUTANT GENERALS OFFICE,
Washington, July 22, 1896.
Major Walter Reed,
Surgeon, U. S. Army,
Washington, D. C.
Through the Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Secretary of War directs, as necessary for the
public service, that you proceed to Key West, Florida, on
business pertaining to the Medical Department, and that, upon
the completion thereof, you return to your station in this
city.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, [unclear]
Acting Adjutant General. mailed July 22, 96
✓

div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to the Adjutant General, July 22, 1896
div1.opener:
All official communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Special duty for medical officer.
War Department,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, July 22, 1896.
To the
ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY,
Sir:-
div1.p:
I have the honor to request that an order may be issued directing
Major Walter Reed, Surgeon U. S. Army, to proceed from this city to Key
West, Florida, on business connected with the Medical Department of the
Army, and upon completion of the duty to return to his station in this city.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, G. M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
Submitted by the Surgeon General to the Honorable the Secretary of War
and approved by him.
G.M.S.
